definition: to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to examine/to investigate/carefully/to try (in court)
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
to estimate/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: No, you will not see them when sizing up the shoreline.
sentences.chinese: 不，你不会看到他们时，审时度势海岸线。

sentences.english: It was time to take stock of the situation.
Until then, we will remain cautious and assess the situation as it unfolds.
sentences.chinese: 不过，在这之前，我们会保持谨慎，审时度势。
